âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Tree view and treemap visualization of disk usage â€¢ Multi-selection in tree and treemap â€¢ User-defined cleanup actions â€¢ Configurable file categories, treemap colors, exclude rules, and tree columns
ðŸ“– Summary: QDirStat is a Qt-based graphical application for analyzing disk space usage on Linux, BSD, and other Unix-like systems, as well as macOS. It provides a tree view and treemap visualization of directories and files, allowing users to identify large files and directories for cleanup. It's a Qt-only port of the original KDirStat, without KDE dependencies.
